definition[0]: a level on a scale that measures something, for example quality or achievement
example[0]: Her new book is several notches above anything else she has written.
example[1]: Jackson raised his voice by a notch.
example[2]: The Spartans turned it up a notch in the second half.
definition[1]: a V-shaped cut or hole in a surface or edge
example[3]: Cut a notch near one end of the stick.
definition[2]: a passage between two mountains or hills
definition[3]: to cut a V-shaped mark into something, especially as a way of showing the number of times something has been done
definition[5]: a degree or level on a scale that measures achievement, price etc
example[4]: The Federal Reserve is expected to reduce interest rates another notch.
example[5]: The 500-stock index gained 0.43 to 358.43, a notch below the record close of 359.80.
definition[6]: to obtain or achieve something important or something that gives you an advantage over other people
example[6]: Boeing quickly notched 49 firm orders for the new plane.
example[7]: Mutual funds that hold stocks in smaller companies havenotched up hugegains.
